org.sakaiproject.util.api

Class MockFormattedText

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sakaiproject.util.api.MockFormattedText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FormattedText

    public class MockFormattedText
extends Object
implements FormattedText
    This is a special Mock which will allow unit testing using FormattedText to generally still work, This is necessary because of all the places where it is used
    Author:
    Aaron Zeckoski (azeckoski @ vt.edu)

      Store the given formatted text in the given XML element; stores both a formatted text representation, and a plaintext representation (plaintext means the formatting has been stripped).

      • processFormattedText

        public String processFormattedText(String strFromBrowser,
                          StringBuffer errorMessages)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        This is maintained for backwards compatibility
        Specified by:
        processFormattedText in interface FormattedText
        See Also:
        FormattedText.processFormattedText(String, StringBuilder)

      • processFormattedText

        public String processFormattedText(String strFromBrowser,
                          StringBuilder errorMessages)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Processes and validates user-entered HTML received from the web browser (from the WYSIWYG editor). Validates that the user input follows the Sakai formatted text specification; disallows dangerous stuff such as <SCRIPT> JavaScript tags. Encodes the text according to the formatted text specification, for the rest of the system to use.
        Use FormattedText.processFormattedText(String, StringBuilder, boolean) if you need the behavior of the old sakai html cleaner processor
        Specified by:
        processFormattedText in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        strFromBrowser - The formatted text as sent from the web browser (from the WYSIWYG editor)
        errorMessages - User-readable error messages will be returned here.
        Returns:
        The validated processed formatted text, ready for use by the system.

      • processFormattedText

        public String processFormattedText(String strFromBrowser,
                          StringBuilder errorMessages,
                          boolean useLegacySakaiCleaner)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Processes and validates user-entered HTML received from the web browser (from the WYSIWYG editor). Validates that the user input follows the Sakai formatted text specification; disallows dangerous stuff such as <SCRIPT> JavaScript tags. Encodes the text according to the formatted text specification, for the rest of the system to use.
        Specified by:
        processFormattedText in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        strFromBrowser - The formatted text as sent from the web browser (from the WYSIWYG editor)
        errorMessages - User-readable error messages will be returned here.
        useLegacySakaiCleaner - if true the old html cleaner is used, if false the new OWASP antisamy cleaner is used
        Returns:
        The validated processed formatted text, ready for use by the system.

      • processHtmlDocument

        public String processHtmlDocument(String strFromBrowser,
                         StringBuilder errorMessages)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Process an HTML document that has been edited using the formatted text widget. The document can contain any valid HTML; it will NOT be checked to eliminate things like image tags, script tags, etc, because it is its own document.
        Specified by:
        processHtmlDocument in interface FormattedText

      • processFormattedText

        public String processFormattedText(String strFromBrowser,
                          StringBuilder errorMessages,
                          boolean checkForEvilTags,
                          boolean replaceWhitespaceTags)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Processes and validates HTML formatted text received from the web browser (from the WYSIWYG editor). Validates that the user input follows the Sakai formatted text specification; can disallow dangerous stuff such as <SCRIPT> JavaScript tags. Encodes the text according to the formatted text specification, for the rest of the system to use.
        Use FormattedText.processFormattedText(String, StringBuilder, boolean, boolean, boolean) if you need the behavior of the old sakai html cleaner processor
        Specified by:
        processFormattedText in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        strFromBrowser - The formatted text as sent from the web browser (from the WYSIWYG editor)
        errorMessages - User-readable error messages will be returned here.
        checkForEvilTags - If true, check for tags and attributes that shouldn't be in formatted text
        replaceWhitespaceTags - If true, clean up line breaks to be like "<br />".
        Returns:
        The validated processed HTML formatted text, ready for use by the system.

      • processFormattedText

        public String processFormattedText(String strFromBrowser,
                          StringBuilder errorMessages,
                          boolean checkForEvilTags,
                          boolean replaceWhitespaceTags,
                          boolean useLegacySakaiCleaner)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Processes and validates HTML formatted text received from the web browser (from the WYSIWYG editor). Validates that the user input follows the Sakai formatted text specification; can disallow dangerous stuff such as <SCRIPT> JavaScript tags. Encodes the text according to the formatted text specification, for the rest of the system to use.
        Specified by:
        processFormattedText in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        strFromBrowser - The formatted text as sent from the web browser (from the WYSIWYG editor)
        errorMessages - User-readable error messages will be returned here.
        checkForEvilTags - If true, check for tags and attributes that shouldn't be in formatted text
        replaceWhitespaceTags - If true, clean up line breaks to be like "<br />".
        useLegacySakaiCleaner - if true the old html cleaner is used, if false the new OWASP antisamy cleaner is used
        Returns:
        The validated processed HTML formatted text, ready for use by the system.

        Returns:

      • convertPlaintextToFormattedText

        public String convertPlaintextToFormattedText(String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Converts the given plain text into HTML formatted text. Conversion to formatted text involves escaping characters that are used for formatting (such as the '<' character). Also converts plaintext line breaks into HTML line breaks ("
        ").
        Specified by:
        convertPlaintextToFormattedText in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        value - The plain text to convert to formatted text
        Returns:
        The converted plain text, now as formatted text

      • escapeHtml

        public String escapeHtml(String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Escape a plaintext string so that it can be output as part of an HTML document. Amperstand, greater-than, less-than, newlines, etc, will be escaped so that they display (instead of being interpreted as formatting). Automatically converts newlines.
        Specified by:
        escapeHtml in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        value - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        value fully escaped for HTML.
        See Also:
        FormattedText.escapeHtml(String, boolean)

      • escapeHtml

        public String escapeHtml(String value,
                boolean escapeNewlines)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Escape the given value so that it appears as-is in HTML - that is, HTML meta-characters like '<' are escaped to HTML character entity references like '<'. Markup, amper, quote are escaped. Whitespace is not.
        Specified by:
        escapeHtml in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        value - The string containing html to escape (can be null or "")
        escapeNewlines - Whether to convert newlines (\n) to "<br />\n" so that they appear as HTML line breaks.
        Returns:
        value fully escaped for HTML (this will never return a null but will instead return empty string - "")

                                String baseAttributeName,
                                String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText

        Specified by:
        encodeFormattedTextAttribute in interface FormattedText

      • encodeUrlsAsHtml

        public String encodeUrlsAsHtml(String text)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        For converting plain-text URLs in a String to HTML <a> tags Any URLs in the source text that happen to be already in a <a> tag will be unaffected.
        Specified by:
        encodeUrlsAsHtml in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        text - the plain text to convert
        Returns:
        the full source text with URLs converted to HTML.

      • unEscapeHtml

        public String unEscapeHtml(String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Returns a String with HTML entity references converted to characters suitable for processing as formatted text.
        Specified by:
        unEscapeHtml in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        value - The text containing entity references (e.g., a News item description).
        Returns:
        The HTML, ready for processing.

      • processAnchor

        public String processAnchor(String anchor)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Returns a String with HTML anchor normalized to include only href and target="_blank" for safe display by a browser.
        Specified by:
        processAnchor in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        anchor - The anchor tag to be normalized.
        Returns:
        The anchor tag containing only href and target="_blank".

      • processEscapedHtml

        public String processEscapedHtml(String source)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Processes and validates character data as HTML. Disallows dangerous stuff such as <SCRIPT> JavaScript tags. Encodes the text according to the formatted text specification, for the rest of the system to use.
        Specified by:
        processEscapedHtml in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        source - The escaped HTML (e.g., from the News service)
        Returns:
        The validated processed formatted text, ready for use by the system.

      • decodeFormattedTextAttribute

        public String decodeFormattedTextAttribute(Element element,
                                  String baseAttributeName)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Retrieves a formatted text attribute from an XML element; converts from older forms of formatted text or plaintext, if found. For example, if the baseAttributeName "foo" is specified, the attribute "foo-html" will be looked for first, and then "foo-formatted", and finally just "foo" (plaintext).
        Specified by:
        decodeFormattedTextAttribute in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        element - The XML element from which to retrieve the formatted text attribute
        baseAttributeName - The base attribute name of the formatted text attribute

      • convertFormattedTextToPlaintext

        public String convertFormattedTextToPlaintext(String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Converts the given HTML formatted text to plain text - loses formatting information. For example, The formatted text "Hello <br /> <b>World!</b>" becomes plain text "Hello \nWorld!" Strips all formatting information from the formatted text
        Specified by:
        convertFormattedTextToPlaintext in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        value - The formatted text to convert
        Returns:
        The plain text (all formatting removed)

      • convertOldFormattedText

        public String convertOldFormattedText(String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Converts old-style formatted text to the new style. Previous to Sakai release 1.5, displayed line breaks were stored as "\n". Now, displayed like breaks are properly stored in the HTML-standard way as "
        ". This method converts from the previous form.
        Specified by:
        convertOldFormattedText in interface FormattedText
        Returns:

      • trimFormattedText

        public boolean trimFormattedText(String formattedText,
                        int maxNumOfChars,
                        StringBuilder strTrimmed)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        Trims a formatted text string to the given maximum number of displayed characters, preserving formatting. For example, trim("Hello & World!", 9) returns "Hello & W" Ignores HTML comments like ""
        Specified by:
        trimFormattedText in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        formattedText - The formatted text to trim
        maxNumOfChars - The maximum number of displayed characters in the returned trimmed formatted text.
        strTrimmed - A StringBuilder to hold the trimmed formatted text
        Returns:
        true If the formatted text was trimmed

      • decodeNumericCharacterReferences

        public String decodeNumericCharacterReferences(String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        decode any HTML Numeric Character References of the style: &#Xhexnumber; or &#decimalnumber; or of our own special style: ^^Xhexnumber^ or ^^decimalnumber^
        Specified by:
        decodeNumericCharacterReferences in interface FormattedText

      • escapeJavascript

        public String escapeJavascript(String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        WEB Utility - Return a string based on value that is safe to place into a javascript / html identifier: anything not alphanumeric change to the char 'x'. If the first character is not alphabetic, a letter 'i' is prepended. Used for generating javascript variable and field names.
        Specified by:
        escapeJavascript in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        value - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        value fully escaped using javascript / html identifier rules.

      • escapeJsQuoted

        public String escapeJsQuoted(String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        WEB Utility - Return a string based on value that is safe to place into a javascript value that is in single quotes. Useful to use with JSON or Javascript variables which are being set dynamically. Can also be accomplished with: Use http://commons.apache.org/lang/api/org/apache/commons/lang/StringEscapeUtils.html
        Specified by:
        escapeJsQuoted in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        value - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        value String escaped for JSON or JS.

      • escapeUrl

        public String escapeUrl(String value)
        Description copied from interface: FormattedText
        WEB Utility - Return a string based on id that is fully escaped using URL rules, using a UTF-8 underlying encoding. Note: java.net.URLEncode.encode() provides a more standard option FormattedText.decodeNumericCharacterReferences() undoes this operation
        Specified by:
        escapeUrl in interface FormattedText
        Parameters:
        value - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        value fully escaped using URL rules.
